The aftermath of the Newtown, Conn. school shooting

Patrick to renew push for stronger Mass. gun laws

Legislation introduced by the governor would, among other things, forbid buyers from purchasing more than one gun a month. (Boston Globe, 5:23 p.m.)

Moore convicted in massacre retrial

Moore convicted in massacre retrial

Dwayne Moore, 35 was convicted of four counts of first-degree murder, as well as home invasion, and armed robbery, in the brutal 2010 slayings. (Globe, 4:25 p.m.)

often must work, too

With his gilded arm and steely determination, Patriots quarterback Tom Brady turned what looked like a blowout loss to the 49ers into a shootout.

Mass. residents have faced tough employment prospects in recent years, but perhaps no group has been harder hit than those between the ages of 16 and 24.

Jordan’s King Abdullah II faces a tricky balancing act on multiple fronts.

Four years after the biggest of the bailouts, federal policy makers are stewing over the choices they made — and struggling to put temporary measures behind them.

The recent trend of juice fasting, which typically involves subsisting on nothing but cold-pressed juice for three to seven days, has surged, but is it really good for you?
